data.title: A Tribute to the Great Women of Latin Music w/ Deborah Resto
meta_keywords: flushing council on culture and the arts
data.meta_description: flushing town hall |   Women's History Month Trilogy #3: Oye Como Va - A Tribute to the Great Women of Latin Music w/ Deborah Resto
data.text:
In-Person Tickets: $15/$12 Members

All individuals must show proof of vaccination against COVID-19 and matching identification to attend this event. If you are interested in attending this event in person, please read the full COVID Safety Policy carefully before purchasing tickets.

Can't make it in person? This performance will be streamed live for FREE on Flushing Town Hall's YouTube Channel. (RSVP HERE to reveice the streaming link and reminder email!)

Featuring the great women of Latin music such as Celia Cruz, La Lupe, and Olga Tanon, Deborah Resto and her ensemble will bring the exotic rhythm and spice of Latin music that gained international popularity spanning over 50 years.

Smooth soul and singer/songwriter Deborah Resto is a New York born Hispanic recording artist, and musician, whose music reflects the very essence of her Latin soul. In addition to her own CD, entitled Let Him Hear My Heart, her tropical R&B voice has been invited onto albums and projects as a background vocalist for many artists, including Christina Aguilera, Marc Anthony, Enrique Iglesias, Paul Simon, Rikki Martin, J.LO, Olga Tanon, Tito Nieves, Tito Puente, Jimmy Sabataer, Ruben Blades, Larry Harlow, and others.
